question: Which sentence uses a conditional correctly?
options: If I will see her, I tell her.
If I saw her, I would tell her.
If I see her, I told her.
If I had saw her, I would told her.

question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: Neither of the boys have done their homework.
Neither of the boys has done his homework.
Neither boys has done their homework.
Neither the boys has done homework.

question: Which is a complex sentence?
options: I went home because I was tired.
